intro: Senecio almorzaderonis, commonly known as the Almorzaderon Senecio, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, showing adaptability to harsh environments. It features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
